While the President continues to call the free press the “enemy of the people” I’m proud to tell you that in Congress the importance of saving local journalism is something Democrats and Republicans still agree on.   https://t.co/QS8hAkg1o0

1 in 5 newspapers in the U.S. have closed since 2004.   Rep. Cicilline introduced the Journalism Competition & Preservation Act because our democracy is strongest when we have a free open press that informs citizens holds public officials accountable and roots out corruption.

.H.R.535 will  🚫 Ban the manufacturing of new PFAS “forever chemicals”   💧Require the EPA to establish clean drinking water standards for the chemicals  💵 Authorize $100 million annually through 2024 to ensure clean drinking water & $100 M towards PFAS treatment technology

Under the Trump administration the EPA has failed to protect our drinking water.   With PFAS toxic chemicals found in 11 places across Rhode Island alone we must take action to protect our water supplies #forthepeople.

In 2016 @realdonaldtrump made an empty promise. @HouseDemocrats kept this promise and will pass legislation to finally allow Medicare to negotiate #LowerDrugCosts – and then make those prices available to people on private insurance. https://t.co/ukV621ibVI

FACT: 3 in 10 American adults reported not taking their medicines as prescribed at because of unaffordable costs.   If that’s not an argument for passing the #LowerDrugCosts Now Act I don’t know what is.
Currently Insulin NovoLOG Flexpen costs RI families about $19800 annually.  H.R.3 can lower this enormous cost by 76%.

Did you know that roughly 83087 Rhode Islanders live with diabetes?  They spend anywhere from $1200 to $20000 on insulin medications annually.  Under the #LowerDrugCosts Now Act they could spend 3.5 times less on Insulin.
103853 Rhode Islanders live with asthma. Under the #LowerDrugCosts Now Act we can lower their total costs for most asthma medications from roughly $1400 to $270 per year.

With the support of @SenatorLeahy and @ChuckGrassley this bill should pass the Senate and head straight to the President’s desk for his signature. It’s long past time we pass this bipartisan fix to a critical problem.
.@HouseJudiciary just passed the CREATES Act clearing the final hurdle before it gets voted out of the House in the coming weeks!

Rep. Cicilline introduced the CREATES Act with strong bipartisan support in the House & Senate to fix this problem. This bill cracks down on anti-competitive practices in the prescription drug market and reduces the deficit by $3.9 billion in the process.

For years big pharma has used abusive tactics to slow down generic competitors from making it to market. This has resulted in higher costs and fewer options for people who just need affordable prescriptions.
The Paris Agreement is a global pact between 200 countries to stand together and fight the climate crisis. Time to stand by it by supporting H.R. 9. #ClimateActionNow
